00001 #ifndef _ESM_REGN_H
00002 #define _ESM_REGN_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * Region data
00010  */
00011 
00012 struct Region
00013 {
00014 #pragma pack(push)
00015 #pragma pack(1)
00016   struct WEATstruct
00017   {
00018     // I guess these are probabilities
00019     char clear, cloudy, foggy, overcast, rain, thunder, ash,
00020       blight,
00021     // Unknown weather, probably snow and something. Only
00022     // present in file version 1.3.
00023       a,b;
00024   }; // 10 bytes
00025 
00026   // Reference to a sound that is played randomly in this region
00027   struct SoundRef
00028   {
00029     NAME32 sound;
00030     char chance;
00031   }; // 33 bytes
00032 #pragma pack(pop)
00033 
00034   WEATstruct data;
00035   int mapColor; // RGBA
00036 
00037   // sleepList refers to a eveled list of creatures you can meet if
00038   // you sleep outside in this region.
00039   std::string name, sleepList;
00040 
00041   std::vector<SoundRef> soundList;
00042 
00043   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00044   {
00045     name = esm.getHNString("FNAM");
00046 
00047     if(esm.getVer() == VER_12)
00048       esm.getHNExact(&data, sizeof(data)-2, "WEAT");
00049     else if(esm.getVer() == VER_13)
00050       esm.getHNExact(&data, sizeof(data), "WEAT");
00051     else esm.fail("Don't know what to do in this version");
00052 
00053     sleepList = esm.getHNOString("BNAM");
00054 
00055     esm.getHNT(mapColor, "CNAM");
00056 
00057     while(esm.hasMoreSubs())
00058       {
00059         SoundRef sr;
00060         esm.getHNT(sr, "SNAM", 33);
00061         soundList.push_back(sr);
00062       }
00063   }
00064 };
00065 }
00066 #endif
